All, yes, that was a responce I was puzzled by, thus I threw it out 
there,=
 here is another I have had and like

I believe they represent the most anc=
ient form of Chinese characters. Oracle bone inscriptions from the 
Shang -=
Zhou dynasty (2000-1000 BC)Stone drum inscriptions from the Warring states =
period (3rd cent. BC). 
I have seen similar tsuba papered as later Hoan by =
the Fittings Museum.

I believe this tsuba may be a copy of something, ther=
e is a rather 'ODD' feel to it, it is pretty light for it's size as well.

=
RIch

 be Satsuma work. Just a 
> gut-feeling guess. 
>
> Ron

   Jim Gilbert wrote:
>
>   > Rich,
>   > Pieces like that seem to have bee=
n used to change the shape of the
>   > seppa dai to accommodate a certain =
shape and/or size of saya and
>   > tsuka.  There are tsuba where the seppa=
 dai has been enlarged by
>   > fitting pieces all of the way around.  Some=
times various pieces
>   > (including the more common hitsuana plugs) are i=
nserted by a later
>   > collector to restore the look of the guard to some=
thing like what he
>   > believes to be its original state.
>   >
>   > I c=
ould imagine a piece like being inserted to repair damage if it
>   > were =
somewhere else on the guard.  It's hard to imagine how that
>   > particula=
r spot would be damaged.
>   >
>   > I have seen a fair number of tsuba tha=
t have a pronounced 
> asymmetry to
>   > the shape of the seppa dai in tha=
t location.  There is metal 
> "missing"
>   > from the same position at th=
e upper right.  My guess is that at some
>   > time and/or place a slightly=
 asymmetrical tsuka or saya shape was in
>   > style and that tsuba were ei=
ther made or modified to accommodate that
>   > shape.  I haven't come acro=
ss such a koshirae and not being a sword
>   > user I can't guess as to why=
 such a shape might be desirable.
>   >
>   > The insert on your guard migh=
t be an attempt to change one of these
>   > tsuba to the more common symme=
trical oval shape.
>   >
>   > Any other ideas?
>   >
>   > Jim
